children.name: Public Speaking
children.description: Traveled to various client offices across the US, presenting to groups of employees about their retirement and equity plans as well as savings strategies

children.name: Project Management
children.description: Managed large (up to $1M) custom web application projects, such as total benefits and wealth accumulation statements, retirement projection tools and financial transactional sites

children.name: Client Management
children.description:
Served as the primary point of contact for multiple client relationships

Listened to the current challenges faced by our clients and discussed strategic and demographic implications related to the plan design, administrative and financial changes to their employee benefit programs

children.name: People Management
children.description:
Managed the staffing of all projects across our East Coast regional offices

Met with direct reports monthly to discuss performance, workload management and career development

Directed recruitment efforts, conducted interviews and presenting at colleges and career fairs

children.name: Staffing
children.description: Managed the staffing of all projects across our East Coast regional offices: Boston, New York and Raleigh

children.name: People Manager
children.description: Held monthly 1-on-1 meetings to discuss workload management, career development, educational goals and performance improvement

children.name: Recruitment
children.description: Supported leadership in attracting, developing and retaining talent by directing recruitment efforts, reviewing resumes and presenting at colleges and career fairs

children.name: Mathematics
children.description:
Graduated with honors in pure mathematics with a focus on probability and statistics

Awarded the Trinity College Presidentâ€™s Fellow for Mathematics in 2008, an award given to one senior in each department who demonstrates outstanding achievement, along with evidence of wide-ranging intellectual interests

children.name: Actuarial & Financial
children.description:
Passed 5 actuarial exams in probability, financial mathematics & economics, life contingencies and actuarial models

Conducted actuarial valuations and consulted on annual compliance, disclosure and funding requirements for pension and retiree medical plans

children.name: Data Anaylsis
children.description:
Analyzed retirement and health care plan data to assess plan adequacy and employee utilization

Wrangle data for data visualizations using tools such as Python

children.name: Machine Learning
children.description:
Self-studied machine learning using Octave and Python libraries like scikit-learn

Experimented with supervised learning algorithms, such as linear regression, logistic regression, neural networks, SVMs, naive bayes and k-nearest neighbors, as well as unsupervised algorithms, such as k-means clustering and PCA
